014package org.jdbi.v3.core.mapper.reflect;
015
016import java.sql.ResultSet;
017import java.sql.ResultSetMetaData;
018import java.sql.SQLException;
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.Collection;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.OptionalInt;
023import java.util.function.Supplier;
024
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.internal.UtilityClassException;
026
027/**
028 * Utilities for reflective mappers.
029 */
030public class ReflectionMapperUtil {
031    private ReflectionMapperUtil() {
032        throw new UtilityClassException();
033    }
034
035    /**
036     * Returns the name of all the columns present in the specified {@link ResultSet}
037     *
038     * @param rs the {@link ResultSet} to get the column names of
039     * @return list of all the column names in {@code rs} (will contain duplicates if multiple columns have the same name)
040     * @throws SQLException See {@link ResultSet#getMetaData()}, {@link ResultSetMetaData#getColumnCount()},
041     *                      and {@link ResultSetMetaData#getColumnLabel(int)}
042     */
043    public static List<String> getColumnNames(ResultSet rs) throws SQLException {
044        final ResultSetMetaData metadata = rs.getMetaData();
045        final int count = metadata.getColumnCount();
046        final List<String> columnNames = new ArrayList<>(count);
047
048        for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
049            columnNames.add(metadata.getColumnLabel(i + 1).toLowerCase());
050        }
051
052        return columnNames;
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Attempts to find the index of a specified column's mapped parameter in a list of column names
057     *
058     * @param paramName          the name of the parameter to search for
059     * @param columnNames        list of column names to search in
060     * @param columnNameMatchers {@link ColumnNameMatcher}s to map {@code paramName} to the column names
061     * @param debugName          name of the parameter to use for debugging purposes (ie: when throwing exceptions)
062     * @return {@link OptionalInt} with the found index, {@link OptionalInt#empty()} otherwise.
063     */
064    public static OptionalInt findColumnIndex(String paramName, List<String> columnNames, List<ColumnNameMatcher> columnNameMatchers, Supplier<String> debugName) {
065        OptionalInt result = OptionalInt.empty();
066
067        for (int i = 0; i < columnNames.size(); i++) {
068            String columnName = columnNames.get(i);
069
070            for (ColumnNameMatcher strategy : columnNameMatchers) {
071                if (strategy.columnNameMatches(columnName, paramName)) {
072                    if (result.isPresent()) {
073                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(String.format(
074                            "'%s' (%s) matches multiple columns: '%s' (%d) and '%s' (%d)",
075                            debugName.get(), paramName,
076                            columnNames.get(result.getAsInt()), result.getAsInt(),
077                            columnNames.get(i), i));
078                    }
079
080                    result = OptionalInt.of(i);
081                    break;
082                }
083            }
084        }
085
086        return result;
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Returns whether any of the given column names begin with the given prefix, according to the list of column name
091     * matchers.
092     *
093     * @param columnNames the column names to search
094     * @param prefix the prefix to search for
095     * @param columnNameMatchers list of column name matchers
096     * @return whether any of the column names begin with the prefix
097     * @since 3.5.0
098     */
099    public static boolean anyColumnsStartWithPrefix(Collection<String> columnNames, String prefix, List<ColumnNameMatcher> columnNameMatchers) {
100        return columnNames.stream().anyMatch(
101            columnName -> columnNameMatchers.stream().anyMatch(
102                matcher -> matcher.columnNameStartsWith(columnName, prefix)));
103    }
104}
